children.subject:
Your 5th Year MS research is generally an extension of your undergrad research. Often, undergrad research topics are kind of just assigned based on your general interests (actually not too different from grad research). So, I guess, don't be worried about finding a topic, just make sure that you are doing research that you are interested in. 

The thesis for the 5th Year MS is basically just a report of what you've done (that's why it's called a "technical report"). You will probably need to include more conceptual background information than you would need to for, say, a class lab report, but it shouldn't be so challenging if you've made some progress in your research (your advisor will be the judge of this). You can look at past technical reports for the program to get an idea of the standard for this kind of thing.

history.content: I'm an undergrad considering the 5th year MS program. For those who have done the program / are currently in it, I'm wondering what the process is like for choosing a thesis topic. How did you decide on the topic of your thesis, and could you elaborate on what the process of writing a thesis is like? Thank you
history.subject: 5th year MS thesis ideas
